of the prepared samples was evaluated by the water splitting reaction under visible light irradiation.The photocatalytic H 2 evolution reactions were performed using a side-irradiated gas-closed system.In each experiment, 50 mg of photocatalysts was dispersed into 80 mL of aqueous solution, which comprised of 15 vol triethanolamine (TEOA) as the sacrificial reagent.Before the light irradiation, the sealed reaction system was purged with high-purity N 2 gas for 0.5 h to remove the dissolved air in the

measured in the three-electrode photoelectrochemical cell using an electrochemical analyzer (CHI-660C, Shanghai Chenhua, China).The FTO substrate with photocatalyst film, Pt wire and AgAgCl were used as the working, counter and reference electrode, respectively.All of the electrodes were dipped into the 0.5 M Na 2 SO 4 electrolyte solution during the whole measurement process.The active area of the present working electrodes is ca.0.5 cm 2 .EIS Nyquist plots were obtained with amplitude of 5 mV over the

According the current results, a possible mechanism for photocatalytic H 2 evolution is proposed (Fig. 9).Under visible light illumination, g-C 3 N 4 can absorb the photons with enough energy to generate the electron-hole pairs.Then, the photo-generated electrons tend to transfer from the conduction band of g-C 3 N 4 to amorphous carbon surface and Pt particles to cause protons reduction reaction, whereas the holes remain in the valence band of g-C 3 N 4 and react with sacrifice regents.As a

The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

Photoelectrochemical properties of the samples were performed in a conventional three electrode system.The

three electrode system.The electrodes were fabricated as following.30 mg of photocatalysts was added into 5 mL of anhydrous ethanol and then grounded to form homogeneous slurry.Subsequently, a doctor blading technique was employed to ensure the same thickness for each photoelectrode.The slurry was coated onto fluorine-doped tin oxide (FTO) substrate.After drying in the air, the electrochemical properties of the photocatalyst deposited on the FTO substrate were measured in the three-electrode
